Belgium: Edward I of England grants Flemish merchants the right to buy wool for export anywhere in the British Isles, rather than being limited to the wool staple.
Burma: Wareru and Tarabya decisively defeat a major Pagan invasion
Spain:
Aragonese troops invaded Castile in support of Alfonso de la Cerda's claim to the throne.
John of Castile, Lord of Valencia de Campos, a son of Alfonso the Wise, was crowned king of León, Seville and Galicia in León, Spain.
Alfonso de la Cerda was crowned king of Castile, Toledo, Córdoba, Murcia and Jaén at Sahagún.
